title: Infectious, Pt. 5: Talk To Me
dc:creator: WBUR
description: At the end of the day, our species only survives if we can communicate. In our fifth and final episode of "Infectious," we hear from those whose lives have been irrevocably altered by vaccines and learn about a radically simple solution to the current controversy – one which has already started to pay dividends.
itunes:author: WBUR
itunes:title: Infectious, Pt. 5: Talk To Me

media:content.media:description: In this Feb. 8, 2019 photo, people hold signs at a rally held in opposition to a proposed bill that would remove parents' ability to claim a philosophical exemption to opt their school-age children out of the combined measles, mumps and rubella vaccine at the Capitol in Olympia, Wash. (AP Photo/Ted S. Warren)
